page.title: 11COAL
page.content: {Coal }is the essence of the community of Kiveton. The colliery was sunk in 1866 and the development of the village followed. At present 767 men are employed by the N.C.B.at the colliery and {production}is a weekly average of 8,000 tons per week. The chief {market} for the fuel is one of the Trentside power stations. A full train of forty wagons carrying a total of 1,000 tons can be loaded in one hour. A new drift mine into the Clowne seam was begun in 1978 and Kiveton is regarded as a 'long life pit'. Further expansion is expected and the{mining future}seems assured with the prospect of new seams being opened.
